This type of clustering is very effective in finding out about what type of business to set up in an area to extract maximum profit or it can be also used to find out about which location is best for a particular business.

element.headline: Data Scientist @ AEREO | MTech CSE IIT Kanpur | Computer Vision | Machine Learning
element.about:
At AEREO, our team has revolutionized open-pit mine safety, developing a unique algorithm for Haul Road detection and implementing cutting-edge segmentation models to enhance various geo-spatial analytics. My role includes fine-tuning state-of-the-art models like Mask-RCNN and leveraging SageMaker for robust training protocols, critical in our success in slashing turnaround times and ensuring precise geo-boundaries.

With a Master of Technology in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Kanpur, my academic foundation complements my practical work, notably as a Teaching Assistant in Computer Networks. My competencies in AWS SageMaker, Geographic Information Systems, and Computer Vision enable our remote teams to excel across multiple projects, from Tree Crown to Building Footprint Detection.

experience.description:
- Developed a bespoke algorithm to detect Haul Roads in Open-pit Mines for Safety Purposes from Drone-based Digital Terrain Model (DTM).
- Developed a Analytical Script to generate Haul Road Analytics slashing the Turn Around Time by 90%.
- Coordinated Remote teams on Multiple Use cases like Mine Bench Crest-Toe Detection, Tree Crown Detection, Building Footprint Detection & Point Cloud Classification
-  Leveraged GIS data to map precise geo-locations, enabling the creation of accurate Geo-boundaries for various applications.
- Researched & Fine-tuned SOTA Segmentation Models like Mask-RCNN & Yolo-Seg for Multiple Use-cases.
- Performed Sagemaker POCs for Model Training purpose.

element.headline: Data Scientist @ Flipkart | IIT Bombay | Machine Learning
element.about:
Flipkart---

Currently I’m working in Search Data Science team at Flipkart. Current working on Personalised Retrieval for FK-search, Also have worked on Ranking models for Shopsy.

Earlier I have worked for 9 months in FK-catalog team mainly of AQC (automated quality check) using GenAI (Gemini), where we automated 20+ guidelines to be checked automatically and evaluated on val dataset.

HERE Technologies---

As a Sr. ML Engineer at HERE Technologies, I worked on innovative solutions for map generation using Generative AI techniques, such as GAN, transformer, and diffusion.

Using contrastive learning for map object classification.

Previously, I worked as an ML Engineer II at HERE Technologies, where I contributed to various projects related to point cloud segmentation, object detection and tracking, and map task identification using state-of-the-art deep learning models, such as DGCNN. 

TCS R&I---

I also worked as an ML Researcher at Tata Consultancy Services, where I won the first prize in AnI KOSH winter season for my paper on automation of image preprocessing using Reinforcement Learning. 

I hold a master's degree in Applied Statistics and Informatics from IIT Bombay. I also authored a book titled "Data Science Placement Preparation Guide", which has been distributed to over 10k+ students and professionals. I am always eager to learn new things and explore new challenges in the field of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.

element.headline: Data Science
element.about:
As a passionate Data Scientist, I thrive on solving complex problems at the intersection of NLP, Deep Learning, and Data Science. With a solid educational foundation from IIT BHU and hands-on experience in developing and deploying scalable AI solutions, I bring both technical expertise and innovative thinking to the table.

My journey spans crafting NLP models to classify unstructured text, fine-tuning large language models for automation, and engineering pipelines to handle real-time data ingestion. Whether it's leveraging BERT for insights, automating processes with Dockerized solutions, or optimizing hyperparameter tuning for deep learning models, I aim to create impactful, efficient solutions.

Key Highlights:

Automated tagging processes using fine-tuned LLM models.
Designed pipelines for seamless ingestion and processing of ECG data from cloud platforms.
Spearheaded initiatives in molecule generation using autoencoders during my internship.
Honored with leadership and excellence awards for extracurricular contributions, including leading the Photography Club at IIT BHU.
I'm always eager to collaborate on challenging projects that push the boundaries of technology and innovation. Let's connect and create something extraordinary together!
element.topSkills: Data Science • Natural Language Processing (NLP) • Deep Learning • Machine Learning Algorithms • Docker

experience.description:
Automated data tagging processes by fine-tuning large language models (LLMs), significantly reducing manual effort.
Analyzed and enhanced BERT models for inference on large unstructured datasets, resolving performance bottlenecks.
Developed NLP models to classify unstructured text into categories such as Disease, Gene Mutation, and Family History with high precision.
Contributed to a module that simplifies the fine-tuning of NLP models, automating hyperparameter tuning, ONNX optimization, and early stopping techniques.

Software Engineer
Built a scalable pipeline for ingesting and processing ECG data from cloud platforms (GCP, Azure), ensuring reliable data flow and storage using Docker.
Designed and implemented end-to-end error monitoring and logging mechanisms to enhance operational reliability.

Automated text extraction workflows using Tesseract and pdf-to-text tools, improving efficiency in document processing.
Designed and implemented a text classification system to accurately categorize content such as Title, Author, and Summary.
Developed post-processing techniques using regex to refine classification results and map patterns for individual articles.

Developed and optimized Variational Autoencoders (VAE) and Adversarial Autoencoders (AAE) for molecule generation, enhancing both accuracy and efficiency.
Collaborated with the team to manage, optimize, and customize generative model code, improving performance and scalability.

element.headline: Data Science at Ninjacart | Myntra | IIIT Delhi

experience.description:
◦ Risk, Collections, Fraud: With Ninjacart pivoting to become a marketplace for farmers and traders with its fintech offerings, my team was responsible for all DS initiatives in the Risk, Collections & Fraud domain:
                - Development of user-level features representative of their credit risk profile
                - Modelling underwriting criteria at eligibility, lending & disbursal stages
                - Provisioning automated underwriting and evaluation of portfolio exposure

◦ Commerce: We developed solutions facilitating traders' engagement on our marketplace platform including lookahead price directionality & gamification initiatives to keep them hooked.

◦ Sales & Distribution: While we stepped into fintech & commerce, we still continued with our fulfilment offerings where our team was pivotal in decisioning initiatives providing demand forecasts at hourly, daily & weekly levels, growth initiatives including next basket prediction as well as SCM optimisation initiatives for creating route plans for our on-ground delivery executives.

◦ Customer Lifecycle Management: Driving a series of initiatives and DS models aimed at acquisition, service, growth and retention for a 1 Lac customer base. These include predictive modelling of customer purchase, churn and lifetime value, optimisation of beat plans for on-ground sales team as well as factor analysis in identifying underlying customer attitude.

◦ Supply Chain Optimisation: Built in-house optimisation modules for optimal facility location for customer delivery, vehicle routing solutions for minimising MML and LML costs and ensemble demand forecasting for reducing the stock dump and loss of sales.

◦ Risk Modelling for Traders: Responsible for churning out critical modules in a trader lending program of 25Cr, including scoring models for quantifying credit risk and predictive inferencing of borrower delinquency.

◦ Tech-led Pricing: Responsible for building ML models and architecture of an automated, goal-seeking revenue & margin optimizing pricing system which takes care of both supply & demand side constraints. It serves as a decision support system for the business team and is responsible for a daily overall revenue of INR 20 million.

◦ Next Basket Recommendation: Built a sequence-aware recommendation system for predicting customer’s basket composition in his next order. The algorithm used is based on Factorising Personalised Markov Chains which combines the advantages of state-of-the-art MF & MC models.

◦ Data-Driven Customer Growth Initiatives: Completed a series of projects targeted at customer growth and retention including monitoring key platform metrics, assessing customer lifetime value, predicting customer churn and predicting his next purchase.

◦ Portfolio Pricing: Built an LSTM model for demand prediction at a product level and implemented a linear
programming-based optimization approach post that, to come up with the best discount configuration at a day-level for all products in the portfolio.
◦ Personalised Pricing: Implemented a word embeddings based model that, for a particular style, shows different prices (personalised coupons) to different customers to nudge them to conversion.

◦ Shenron - API Provisioning Platform: Built a platform to develop, build, test and host Data Science APIs.
Two core components: API Code Generator Module + Provisioning layer (PaaS).

◦ Sentient: Built a real-time ingestion & processing pipeline using Spark Streaming to feed customer interactions to a flagging model that identifies customer pain points & enables quick RCA for the same.

◦ Business - uStream & pStream: Built the two pivotal data streams - the user stream (one store for all
customer interactions) & the product stream (most actionable product metrics) that form the basis of most systems and models built by the Data Science team.

◦ Clickstream - Explore: Built the data ingestion pipeline for Explore, a system that aids in understanding how our consumers browse and buy things.

projects.title: Optimizing large-scale Wi-Fi networks
projects.associatedWith: Associated with Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology, Delhi
projects.description: Use of off-the-shelf WIPS (Wireless Intrusion Prevention System) to deal with interference in enterprise 802.11 networks. Interference, posed by non-enterprise WiFi networks (networks of sensors and other user devices), which may be legitimate and non-malicious but the centralised controller may not have an explicit way to co-operate with them. We argue that a rethink of interference management techniques is required at the enterprise controller.

experience.position: DC Analyst | Data Scientist - Mars Inc.
experience.description:
Overview:
Cash forecasting provides visibility into liquidity and helps control cash flow for working capital. This covers forecasts in local currencies per region for each legal entity and includes FX forecasting to manage hedging against international markets and currency conversion risk in Anaplan.

Industry: Consumer Goods / Pet Care
Sector:   Household Goods
Client:   Mars, Incorporated — CASH and FX Team

Business Context : 
As a Techno-functional Developer, cash forecasting captures expected cash inflows and outflows by local currency (e.g., INR for India) to ensure adequate liquidity and optimize working capital. FX forecasting models currency movements to support hedging decisions where the document currency (e.g., USD when paying a US vendor) must be converted to local currency. The organizational currency hierarchy (MOE) drives how data is aggregated and reported across regions and entities. We then forecast with the best MAPE values using the  ML models. The Anaplan team will handle the display of forecasts and dashboards for clients.

Tools - 
Big Data & Processing: Databricks, Spark, PySpark
Orchestration / ETL: Azure Data Factory (DEV/PROD), Autosys
Data Storage: ADLS (Azure Data Lake Storage), Anaplan (Data Hub / Spoke)
Languages / Libraries: Python (pandas, numpy, ml libs), SQL
DevOps & Versioning: Azure DevOps, 
Other:  Time series ML frameworks, ML libraries (used in Databricks)

projects.title: ANALYSIS OF VIBRATION ATTENUATION AT RAIL JOINTS WITH DYNAMIC VIBRATION ABSORBER (DVA) BY USING  EPDM RUBBER
projects.description: Analysis of Vibration Attenuation at Rail Joints with Dynamic Vibration Absorber (DVA) by using EPDM Rubber. In this project nearly 6 members team with one mentor. I lead this project under a mentor. We did this project within 2 months at S.C.Railway/P.way/Renigunta(RU). Here, we replaced HDPE Railway pads at Thermit welding joint with the EPDM Pads as single layer and double layer pads then, we extracted values from vibrometer in the form of frequencies as a variable parameter afterwards comparing value 58% and 71% reduction in mean frequencies values with respect to HDPE Pad also we did CAE Modal analysis at mean frequencies and found out displacement in that are reducing up to 69.8% and 85.2% respectively with HDPE pad.

Data Scientist with experience in leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, timeseries forecasting, deep learning algorithms and AI techniques to drive actionable insights in supply chain, logistics, procurement, and inventory management. Proven track record in demand forecasting, predictive modeling, optimization algorithms, and real-time analytics across FMCG, retail, Pharmaceuticals health care and manufacturing domains. Adept at cross-functional collaboration with operations, sourcing, finance, and IT teams.

##Key Skill

*Statistical Skills	:	Descriptive Statistics, Inferential Statistics, Hypothesis Testing and Actuarial statistics. 				(Chi squared testing, t test, z test, Anova and A-B testing,probability)

*Programming Tools :	Python(Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, ScikitLearn,XGB,Gorobi,CPLEX)
Pyspark,R programming, R shiny, R markdown, SAS 9.1s, git.

				(linear regresion, logistic regression,Decision Trees, Random forest, XGBoost, 						LightGBM, CatBoost, Support Vector Machines,K-mean clustering,K Nearest Neighbors)

*Time series	:	supply chain, Demad planing, Sales forecasting, Lead Time Forecasting,Hierarchical 				Forecasting,Causal Forecasting (Arima, Sarima, Holt, ETS, BATS, TBATS, Prophet, 				Croston, LSTM, Var, CausalImpact, DoWhy, scikit-hts)

*Deep Learning	:	ANN/CNN/RNN(LSTM) and Self Organizing Maps (Tensorflow/Keras)

*Optimization	:	Inventory Optimization,Warehouse Storage Optimization, Linear Programming (LP), 				Mixed-Integer Programming (MIP)(SciPy.optimize, Google OR-Tools, pyomo, Gurobi, 				CPLEX)

*NLP	:	Entity Recognition,Sentiment Analysis,Text preprocessing,vectot embiding,Chat-bot.
				(Spacy, NLTK, Gensim, BERT)

*Model Evaluation	:	Model performance evaluation using confusion matrix/K cross validation/R2/RMSE/
				MAPE /Bias /F1 score/confusion matrix/Accuracy/ROC/AUC.				

*Parameter Tuning   :		Used Grid Search, Random search, Bayesian optimization, Gradient-based optimization, Evolutionary optimization to identify the best parameters for the model
Data Visualization   :	Power BI, Tableau, Excel, matplotlib, seaborn, Plotly, Dash, R Shiny, ggplot2

*ETL Tools	:	SAS 9.1

*Database Skills	:	MS SQL,MongoDB(Basic)

*Gen AI 	:	 Chat GPT, Gemini

element.headline: Data Science @ Rapido | Ex-Walmart, ZS
element.about:
Getting right into it, here’s what you’d want to know about me:

1.     I’m a post-graduate Data Scientist and Computer Engineer; with experience in retail at Walmart and healthcare at ZS. This multitude of experiences made me get a “Thali” of skills and interests (It is an Indian meal, Google it!)

2.    My plethora of passions condensed to my moving to the United States to attend graduate school at Carnegie Mellon University, where I study Information Systems with a focus on Data Analytics and Data Science

3.     I still (and always will) think like an engineer, and love to get to the bottom of situations to understand what is going on. This helped me understand my client’s business and solve difficult problems at ZS

4.     I wrote my first piece of code in QBASIC aged 10, and never looked back. I have tried numerous languages since then and realized I enjoy the logical aspect more than anything else, settling on Java, Python, and SQL as my arsenal of choice

5.     I had an unconventional start to my career; I was one of the winners of an analytics competition called the ZS CampusBeats Case study challenge in India, landing a job at the firm

6.      Working in consulting for over a year taught me how to work in a fast-paced environment, and helped me upskill rapidly. I worked with immense amounts of data using PostgreSQL and Python

If any of this resonated or you’re interested in having a chat, I love meeting new people and would be glad to exchange ideas!

Apart from working in the same organization Pratyaksh is also my junior in college and I have had a chance to lead him in the MUN Secretariat as well, he is an avid debater with a sound sense of logic and keen interest in world issues. A hard-working and diligent individual, Pratyaksh is suited for every opportunity that comes his way and can easily transition into leadership roles and will do justice to it entirely.
